sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K727777
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: FMO3 (flavin monooxygenase 3) is an enzyme that catalyses the oxidation of TMA (trimethylamine) into TMAO (trimethylamine oxide) which results as the removal of unpleasant fish odor.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: İBRAHİM YASİR ORHAN

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: luxI
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
Synthesizes 3OC6HSL, which binds to LuxR.

The lux cassette of V. fischeri contains a left and a right promoter. The right promoter gives weak constitutive expression of downstream genes.This expression is up-regulated by the action of the Lux repressor, LuxR. Two molecules of LuxR protein form a complex with two molecules the signalling compound HSL. This complex binds to a palindromic site on the promoter, increasing the rate of transcription.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: An LVA tail (sequence: AANDENYALVA) was added to increase protein degradation. .
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Vinay S Mahajan, Voichita D. Marinescu, Brian Chow, Alexander D Wissner-Gross and Peter Carr

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: luxr
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
In complex with HSL, LuxR binds to the Lux promoter, activating transcription from Pr BBa_R0062, and repressing transcription from Pl BBa_R0063.

The lux cassette of V. fischeri contains a left and a right promoter. The right promoter gives weak constitutive expression of downstream genes.This expression is up-regulated by the action of the Lux activator, LuxR complexed to HSL. Two molecules of LuxR protein form a complex with two molecules the signalling compound homoserine lactone (HSL). This complex binds to a palindromic site on the promoter, increasing the rate of transcription.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: 2 silent point mutants were introduced in the coding sequence to remove internal XbaI and PstI sites. Mutation sites were chosen to replace codons commonly used in E. coli with codons used at a similar frequency.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Vinay S Mahajan, Voichita D. Marinescu, Brian Chow, Alexander D Wissner-Gross and Peter Carr

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: lux pR
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
Promoter activated by LuxR in concert with HSL

The lux cassette of V. fischeri contains a left and a right promoter. The right promoter gives weak constitutive expression of downstream genes.This expression is up-regulated by the action of the LuxR activator protein complexed with the autoinducer, 3-oxo-hexanoyl-HSL. Two molecules of LuxR protein form a complex with two molecules of the signalling compound homoserine lactone (HSL). This complex binds to a palindromic site on the promoter, increasing the rate of transcription.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: This promoter is based on the Vibrio fischeri quorum sensing gene promoters. Two genes LuxI and LuxR and transcribed in opposite directions as shown below. The original sequence from which the parts BBa_R0062 and BBa_R0063 were derived is shown in the picture below.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Vinay S Mahajan, Voichita D. Marinescu, Brian Chow, Alexander D Wissner-Gross and Peter Carr

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K727004
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: FMO3 (flavin monooxygenase 3) is an enzyme that catalyses the oxidation of TMA (trimethylamine) into TMAO (trimethylamine oxide) which results as the removal of unpleasant fish odor.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: İBRAHİM YASİR ORHAN
